Using Visual Merge as a Stand-alone Utility

Visual Merge establishes a three-way comparison between the two "new" revisions of a file and the revision of the file on which both were based. It can be used as a stand-alone utility or accessed from the command line.

To access Visual Merge as a stand-alone utility:

  1. Do one of the following:

    • Double-click the Visual Merge icon in StarTeam.

    • Select Start > Programs > StarTeam > StarTeam client_name  > Visual Merge.

    The Visual Merge Info dialog opens.

  2.  In the Visual Merge Info dialog, you must provide the paths to all three files:

    • In the Common file text box, enter or browse for the common ancestor of the two files that will be merged.

    • In the First file text box, enter or browse for the name of the first file.

    • In the Second file text box, enter or browse for the name of the second file.

  3. In the Results file text box, enter or browse for the name of the file that will be used to store the results of the three-way comparison. You can edit these results.

  4. Click OK to start the merge process.
